item.title: By: Stefan Lasiewski
item.dc:creator: Stefan Lasiewski
item.description:
Andrew, can you clarify something?
In your instructions, you use `mcm/bin/mcmd`:
billy@black:~$ tar xfz mcm-1.2.1-cluster-7.2.9-linux-glibc2.5-x86-32bit.tar.gz billy@black:~$ mv mcm-1.2.1-cluster-7.2.9-linux-glibc2.5-x86-32bit mcm billy@black:~$ mcm/bin/mcmd --bootstrap
But when I download the tarball from Oracle Edelivery, I need to use a different path. I need to use mcm/mcm1.x.y/bin instead of mcm/bin/ . Has the path changed? Am I downloading the right product?
[stefanl@db1 ~]$ tar xfz mcm-1.2.4-cluster-7.3.2-linux-rhel5-x86-64bit.tar.gz ### Move the directory, like they do in the tutorial [stefanl@db1 ~]$ mv mcm-1.2.4-cluster-7.3.2-linux-rhel5-x86-64bit mcm [stefanl@db1 ~]$ mcm/bin/mcmd bash: mcm/bin/mcmd: No such file or directory ### Where is mcmd??? It's under mcm/mcm1.2.4/bin , not mcm/bin . [stefanl@db1 ~]$ mcm/mcm1.2.4/bin/mcmd --bootstrap MySQL Cluster Manager 1.2.4 (64bit) started [stefanl@db1 ~]$
item.content:encoded:
Andrew, can you clarify something?

In your instructions, you use `mcm/bin/mcmd`:

billy@black:~$ tar xfz mcm-1.2.1-cluster-7.2.9-linux-glibc2.5-x86-32bit.tar.gz
billy@black:~$ mv mcm-1.2.1-cluster-7.2.9-linux-glibc2.5-x86-32bit mcm
billy@black:~$ mcm/bin/mcmd –bootstrap

But when I download the tarball from Oracle Edelivery, I need to use a different path. I need to use mcm/mcm1.x.y/bin instead of mcm/bin/ . Has the path changed? Am I downloading the right product?

[stefanl@db1 ~]$ tar xfz mcm-1.2.4-cluster-7.3.2-linux-rhel5-x86-64bit.tar.gz
### Move the directory, like they do in the tutorial
[stefanl@db1 ~]$ mv mcm-1.2.4-cluster-7.3.2-linux-rhel5-x86-64bit mcm
[stefanl@db1 ~]$ mcm/bin/mcmd
bash: mcm/bin/mcmd: No such file or directory
### Where is mcmd??? It’s under mcm/mcm1.2.4/bin , not mcm/bin .
[stefanl@db1 ~]$ mcm/mcm1.2.4/bin/mcmd –bootstrap
MySQL Cluster Manager 1.2.4 (64bit) started
[stefanl@db1 ~]$

item.title: By: Bheem

Andrew,
Very nice article and tutorial. I downloaded the white paper and found that the upgrade information provided is not complete and clear under section 3.4.11.
There are no clear steps on how to upgrade the existing mcm to 1.2 version.
The doc says, just stop the agents. That's it.
Any help on this, please? Thanks
